item.title: Drew add a quote by Franklin Delano Roosevelt
item.description: "We have always known that heedless self interest was bad morals, we now know that it is bad economics." -- Franklin Delano Roosevelt

item.title: Drew add a quote by Glenn Gould
item.description: "The purpose of art is not the release of a momentary ejection of adrenaline but rather the gradual, lifelong construction of a state of wonder and serenity." -- Glenn Gould

item.title: Drew add a quote by Mstislav Rostropovich
item.description: "I would rather have ideas and some difficulties of technique than a perfect technique and no ideas." -- Mstislav Rostropovich

item.title: Drew add a quote by Mstislav Rostropovich
item.description: "Explain to me please why in our literature and art so often people absolutely incompetent in the field have the final word." -- Mstislav Rostropovich

item.title: Drew add a quote by Mstislav Rostropovich
item.description: "Every man must have the right fearlessly to think independently and express his opinion about what he knows, what he has personally thought about and experienced, and not merely to express with slightly different variations the opinion which has been inculcated in him." -- Mstislav Rostropovich

item.title: Drew add a quote by Igor Stravinsky
item.description: "Music is the sole domain in which man realizes the present." -- Igor Stravinsky

item.title: Drew add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Once there were brook trout in the streams in the mountains. You could see them standing in the amber current where the white edges of their fins wimpled softly in the flow. They smelled of moss in your hand. Polished and muscular and torsional. On their backs were vermiculate patterns that were maps of the world in its becoming. Maps and mazes. Of a thing which could not be put back. Not be made right again. In the deep glens where they lived all things were older than man and they hummed of mystery." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Drew add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "In the spaniards heart is a great yearning for freedom, but only his own. A great love for truth and honor in all its forms, but not in its substance. And a deep conviction that nothing can be proven except that it be made to bleed. Virgins, bulls, men. Ultimately God himself." -- Cormac McCarthy
